ygData.subject: Mages soloing..... err Grouping? (was Mistmoore and Dark elf camp in Lesser Faydark)

ygData.messageBody:
i agree, and to make a sweeping generalization if i may :)

Mages cant group

To many times i have seen mages nuke a runner down when it wasnt necessary,
nuke a messed mob or generally just solo in a group (if thats possible).

Last night, i grouped with a few of my good friends in our alternate group

In this group is a bard (me) an enchanter, shaman and magician. Now in our
regular group the person playing the mage plays one of the best ever
paladins i have seen, and i would trust her with my life, and have all too
frequently. Now i dont know what it is about mages, or if they are hard to
play (never played one) or if this paladin just cant play a caster, but
there is nothing better than hearing "That is not a legal target master" at
least 10 times each fight :), and wondering why gobaner isnt doing anything,
or why the mage used a 300 damage nuke on a mob with 20 HP left, or why she
continuly attacked the messed mobs or ......

Anyway if anyone has any positive mage grouping experiences please share
them as i would like to know so perhaps i can change my mage friends' ways.


----- Original Message -----
From: Bill Costlow <atlatyl@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, July 19, 2000 8:34 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Mistmoore and Dark elf camp in Lesser Faydark


> --- Melaniel <online.games@...> wrote:
> >
> >every time I've
> > joined a group with one, it appears to me as if they
> > are soloing while
> > only notionally grouping (if that makes sense).
>
> A scene from the Temple room in Dalnir:
>
> (after a heavy fight)
> Magician: WhhooooHhooooo! We rule! Ain't my AOE
> spell Purty?
> Enchanter: Very nice -- except it cancels out my mezz
> spells.
> Magician: Then don't use Mezz.
> Bard: But (name deleted) the AOE mezz is a crowd
> control spell that keeps us alive...
> Magician: I AM CROWD CONTROL!
>
> sheesh
